page.title: 20CONSERVATION IN NEWTON.
page.content: Felling of dead and over-crowded trees from a copse to open up views of the church has led to an increase in floral species from 13 to 42 in 3 years.The spread of the new species is being helped by selective hand-weeding of rapidly-growing undesirables such as Ragwort,Elder and Creeping Thistle. 8 species of bird nested in the copse this year. Some nettles are being maintained to provide breeding grounds for several species of butterflies. Access to village footpaths has been improved by building new stiles. 12 mallard ,hand-reared from eggs taken froma nest where the mother had been killed,have been given a home on a secluded village pool.
